oHJJXvwOK7L2V24xsIb8NQ.text: I heard about this place by word of mouth, and the hype was trully deserved, best hot dogs ever, 4 very different kinds of sausage, each with a very distinctive flavour and texture, lots of toppings (3 different kind of mustards to give you a clue), great caramelized onions and lovely super fresh and soft buns, what is not to like!!!!! Give it a try, I am sure you will love it, we need more good value, excellent street food like this in London.Juan Gerdts

b4TCMiz6Gj_C2_1GOqzLcw.text: This dog really needs to be taken for a long walk. Tasty, big meaty hotdogs that filled the bun. Good range to sample and much nicer than a sausage in in a bun. If you're close by and want something better than a sandwich your really have to try these dogs. Warning, if you're on a diet these dogs have serious fill me up bite.

MeWDTxuiXe6a-Dke-oXD5Q.text: Hmm I loves me a hot dog, it was soo good, plenty of sauces for me to enjoy.

HEYMAwQa6WjHp2QMzH5Tgg.text: Absolutely irresistible hotdogs. My kids are mad about them!

RCxkKZHdwWadrS8Ir_l-3g.text: The Hod Dog are delicious and very big !!!

C9yyxZR46Si6aEvPfdppJw.text: Me on my commute home. Pretty much every single day: "Hmm... what do I want to cook tonight? Man... I'm famished... "*meat smells wafting from hot dog cart* Then, good Katie says: "Stay strong, Katie, you don't need a hot dog. You know you probably don't have any cash anyhow... you're like 2 blocks from home, then you can cook a proper dinner"Usually, good Katie wins. But one day last week, bad Katie reared her ugly face"Kaaaatie. You have cash in your wallet. And you have to try one at SOME point, no?"Oh, alright fine!I ate it. It was delicious. Part beef, part pork, salty, but not too salty, extremely juicy, and completely worth the indulgence (and £4).

-CDGWpOQ2SXbZqBPmUS-IA.text: The client treated us to lunch here. He's a recent convert to hot dogs for lunch and goes to BAHD frequently.  Our crew rated the dogs at A1. Even the mustard was from back home.  Who would have that something like this would be found in London England? There is supposed to be a sit down restaurant serving US style hot dogs somewhere in London, but we ran out of time before trying to find it.

e-USmFdG9L8T1TneE_KvKg.text: While I worked this past summer in London, I made a point to go to as many food trucks and street vendors as humanly possible.  This one, which I visited the day before I left, managed to top my list of favorites.  It was a rainy day, but I was determined to make it there, and I'm so glad I did!  My only regret is not visiting sooner and more often throughout my stay.First of all, Abiye is an incredibly nice guy.  Though I'd only planned on stopping by for a quick bite, I ended up hanging out at the stand for a couple hours.  That is not an exaggeration.  For someone who has to hang out in the cold with little more than a tarp to protect him from the elements, the guy's chatty and kind to pretty much anybody who stops by.Now, the sausages themselves are to die for.  They're handmade and come in several different varieties.  My first choice was the "Big Frank" pork dog, but later went ahead and tried the skinny beef ones as well.  Yeah, I had multiple hot dogs in one (admittedly prolonged) sitting.  It happens.  Both were fantastic, but I still think of the pork when experiencing London food nostalgia -- it happens more often than you'd think. The buns are fresh and fluffy, the perfect complement to the amazing dog.  There's also a wealth of choices to be had in a spread of toppings sure to satisfy every palette, though I personally prefer to go with just ketchup.  My only complaint is that it's so far away and I'm not sure when I'll be in London next.  But when I get back, I know where I'm going for lunch.

I-HuXkerZk1Km30WY-m9og.text: Not your regular London hot dog! Big Apple Hotdogs are a traditional American Hot Dog Cart in London (Not to be confused with the traditional English vendors that sell old hot dogs by night bus routes in central London). There are a variety of different hot dogs on offer (Frankfurter, pork/beef combo, etc). They are all sourced lcoally using the best ingredients and served on a fluffy white hot dog bun. There are also plently of American condiments on offer. I loved the onions, ketchup and squeezey cheese!

NaIgNj7mJX633z2BXLvm-A.text: I had the free range pork sausage which was delicious! The man serving them was very funny and knowledgeable, and made it rather difficult to choose which one to go for! They were large portions otherwise I would have tried them all. Absolutely perfect and very filling.

photos.caption: Photo of Big Apple Hot Dogs - London, United Kingdom

Bz8DbRkHOZ7oa46L0CbhRQ.text: Don't expect a classic NYC street vendor "dirty water" hot dog. With that said, these are very good hot dogs in their own right.

bk6OoKfW0WdrD_7PhydWXQ.text: The delicious sausages are handmade in London and all over 90% meat, finally we can forget the notion that hot dogs have to be made of nasty stuff. I love the sign on the cart that says: "no bones, no brains, no ears" - good to know!Choose your sausage from a selection of pork, beef or pork & beef, wrap it in a bun baked locally by Anderson's of Hoxton, add some delicious fried onion, ketchup, mustard and squeezy cheese and bite - you will be back again next week.The Big Apple cart is just past the Fire Station on Old Street from 12pm until 6pm Tuesday to Friday.This will be the best hot dog you ever eat!

f7nZdttrBCEKlG7pyqdr6w.text: Huge, delicious hot dogs. Genuinely make you feel like you're in the Big Apple chewing down on one of New York's best. Actually screw that, the quality of the meat is even better than in New York. Yeah, I said it!There's also a great choice of dogs, great ingredients, even the buns are fluffy and delicious, there's a great array of toppings, the caramalised onions are perfect  cracking.

w0GJo1PMtdYAHplaJwKWBw.text: Wonderful lip smacking hot dogs are served here. Served with different sausages and caramalised onion, all complimenting each other.

8V3KCB_ADCFY_0t1-D1gUA.text: Huge, delicious hot dogs. Great service and atmosphere !Prices are good too.

rUzGv8JXe5BDYj84C7hOFA.text: Tried this the other dayI have to say. Its really good

RlMWpimHjE6pxpQgX7hS9g.text: Best hot-dogs in London. If you haven't been here before make sure you go, otherwise you will miss a lot. Absolutely worth it.

I_5zwn2Jboox338IkUAWVw.text: Just discovered the place last week and was seriously amazed. Hot dogs are very basic but taste awesome. A wider range of sauces will be much appreciated though.

eHYtNrQ_FWv8HlqgsFtePg.text: I know that it's just a hot dog stand, but for some reasons it's just irresistible ! Always hot and fresh. I've been going to this stand for 2 months and all I can say is give it a try for yourself.

lkpJWkspfhEvvjq9yQcErw.text: Great hotdogs, the best in town. You can try them in a combination with different sausages, which is great. love all of them.

5h336U3zuHwLv2nHnrHD6Q.text: Now, I should start with the bad point. Big Apple Hot Dogs is less than a ten minute stroll from the office which means I eat here frequently. That's it. That's the only bad thing I can think of.Now for the good things.. First you have the staff, rain or shine Abiye and Jenny always have a smile on their faces and fire in their belly over the product they serve up and what a product because you guessed it, the dawgs are good, better than good! Take all your pre-conceived ideas of a hot dog and throw them in the bin with the Wrestlers, these dawgs ARE the bollox, whether it's a a Big Frank, Junior Frank, Big Dog or the all beef Pimp Steak Dog your taste buds are in for a treat. All the dogs are prepared to a 'secret' recipe by a Polish artisan and served up on freshly baked buns and can be topped with the obligatory onions and a wide array of mustards, ketchups, pickles, sauerkraut and if you're really adventurous, The Rib Man's Holy F*ck hot sauce!Throw in a loyalty card and it's no wonder I've had to up my gym intake to work off these babies. Priced at between £3 and £4 you won't get a better or more satisfying lunch or after work snack around Old Street.

x8VjvrFyWMIFX-K6q6mHlw.text: The greatest hot dogs in London. Try them!

ZTRzTd3xpqXwiHouPXAoFA.text: Sampled these awesome hot dogs at the Yelp! London bash. They are HUGE! The smell wafting throughout the room made my tummy rumble and when I got to sample one I certainly wasn't disappointed. Davide gave me one pork and one beef sausage, loaded with onions, ketchup, and cheese.  Can't wait to try another one soon!

AZPAjY_hC53PDJlexDeSNQ.text: Ah the big dog! love the hot dogs prepared here, real meaty sausages it went down a treat.

hXQvHkLI0M_e-RBghgQGLA.text: The Hod Dog are delicious and very big !!!

JY-KktWQoGVPRpULWmM7kA.text: If you're not a Londoner, you'll notice how every local is talking about the famous hot dogs. Big Apple's hot dogs? What is that? This is like our cult, our tradition. If you want to become one of us, you must follow this ritual. Every time you are in Kings Cross, no matter what you're up to, you need to come down and have an amazing hot dog. Big Apple's hot dogs are not just a pleasure to eat, but they taste authentic and you know you're not eating some junk from a crappy street booth.

pir-nIEdyxt3EBxNi79mSw.text: To eat, or not to eat? This aren't just any regular hot dogs. They honor London's junk food as these hot dogs are considered the tastiest, most delicious in the area, in fact -- the whole town. There is no need to say more. Get yourself one now!

-qyoeLH7Mub_vHa2G3Io_g.text: Damn good dogs, I must say! Lucky for me, Big Apple Hot Dogs sets up shop (tent + grill) quite close to my flat (they are on Old Street, near the Shoreditch Fire Station)...but today was the first day I made it over for lunch. Their hours say 12-6pm on the website, but they were closing up shop around 3pm, so I am not really sure that one should go by that. More like, if you happen to see them or are in the area...GO GET YOURSELF ONE. Don't make a special trip. My husband and I both had the "Big Dog" -- mine with onions, both with pickles. Unlike any self-respecting real Chicagoan, I put ketchup on mine. Thankfully, in London no one stares at you sideways when doing so. I like ketchup, so there! They have a nice condiment lineup, complete with sauerkraut, mustard, ketchup, gherkins/pickles, etc that you do yourself. The buns were freshly toasted, perfection! At £10 for 2 dogs, it's certainly not "cheap" -- but they are very good. Worth a quick lunch stop.

9usYXefg5WZZkcdWCV9tvQ.text: Top notch beef hot dog! Need I say more? There's not many places I know over here that have beef hotdogs and these are absolutely yummy with the soft hot dog rolls with caramelised onions with ketchup and mustard! Yum!

ATOPkIUU8vTxVKBxPYRe9g.text: Best hog dog in London? You bet!I have sampled a Big Apple hot dog on a couple of occasions and if different locations, but the most memorable was at Grillstock in Bristol.I was there for the weekend, so on the Saturday I treated myself to a 'Huge Pole' a succulent 8 inch beef & pork dog sausage seasoned with sage, mace and cayenne peppe, a real mouth fall, really delicious!Then on the Sunday we were back, my mate Dave was chatting away to the owner Abiye and the topic food challenges came up, then Abiye laid down the challenge, some guy had done a double 'Huge Pole' but someone needed to take it up a notch, yep, that guy was me.The Triple Pole: The deal was I had to fit a everything in my gob and have a bite, then I had to finish the beast and If I completed the challenge, the 'Triple Pole' would be on Abiye.Guess what? I demolished it with ease, and the main reason was the standard of those sausages, so tasty I manged three of the buggers and that's why Big Apple Hot Dogs is the best hot dog in London.

photos.caption: Photo of Big Apple Hot Dogs - London, United Kingdom. IN IT GOES!
Photo of Big Apple Hot Dogs - London, United Kingdom. Here I Go!
Photo of Big Apple Hot Dogs - London, United Kingdom. The Triple Pole in all it's glory

k8a0IfCRsHonMLb4djRvqw.text: Amazing hotdogs that really hit the spot!I highly recommend the Polish Sausage with sauerkraut and spicy sauce.Being extremely tasty and receiving a good portion sizes makes this place a must visit!

d0zuBAfQFg1qJmRFml7xxA.text: Not quite your run of the mill corner of NYC vendors but one of the best hot dogs In town @ if you're ever passing this way on train or just wandering go here. Prob the best hot dogs in town bar the fads that are now arriving.

IAM_l3jNXIpirHB9CTUGDA.text: It's not the cheapest of hot dogs (£5 for a small hot dog - if you're hungry, you'll probably need two), but its delightfully delicious. I took the big frank one (pork and beef) with ketchup and mustard. One of the best hot dogs I had in my life! Strongly recommended.

v6aJlrsCUk73qESXjwqJtg.text: Found this little place after exploring near my work for new places to have lunch. Big Apple Hot Dogs is located at the lower end of Caledonian Road, just near the bridge over Regents Canal, and fairly inconspicuous in amongst the standard greasy spoons and off-licences found in the same stretch. Despite this, it's worth going the extra mile for, as the hot dogs are amazing. Fairly simple, no frills, you get a choice of differing dogs, a bun, onions and mustard or ketchup, all for a fiver or below. The dogs are well made, meaty and delicious, the bun fluffy and fresh, and it all makes quite a good meal with which to pop yourself down by the canal, and watch the world go by, as you make happy eating noises at the deliciousness of their wares. Alternatively, the establishment have a small roped off area out the front in which to eart, if you dare not venture far with your newly acquired hot dog.Seriously, if you're in Kings Cross, and want something decent, with no frills for lunch, make the trip up Cally Road - you won't regret it.

rDXBFxj-FOVgwA9Tm1rTiw.text: Food was good. I got a kick out of those hot dogs.Im not able to spell the guys name who gave me my food but it was a interesting experience.

RfmfI-i6UuFaWMQ1mBRraw.text: I had the luck of trying these bad boys at Feast this year. Hot dogs always bring me back to summers in New Jersey with my family, so I wanted to get one with the right flavours. The Big Frank was perfect! I love that they offer all toppings for free so you can have as much or as little as you want. Sure they're a bit more expensive than the hot dog stands in NYC would be but oh well, supply and demand. I just had an interview near Old Street so now I'm really hoping I get it so that I can come here for lunch!

photos.caption: Photo of Big Apple Hot Dogs - London, United Kingdom. Big Frank shared between very differing tastes - both sides delish!

AP2Cyz10v1RJfjVdumlhIg.text: A bit out of the way (quiet, and no tourists!) and the hot hot dogs were fresh, delicious, and hit the spot.

-w5KESN9-9TaKpf1y1aMAQ.text: I am not one to normally eat hot dogs...in fact as a child perhaps my greatest sin as an American was to refuse to eat them. Was resistant to the idea when my boyfriend ordered one tonight from the euston station stand (it was the only late night option) but Lordy they are fantastic! And with great service. Well done.

7Qd38TQ3FilcZcaQIK2G5Q.text: Had the chance to taste one at a yelp community event tonight. Great hot dog by American standards, so probably the best in London as well. Nice fluffy bun, not overly sweet. Decent size dog, grilled to perfection. Loving the onions and pickles. Topped off with American french's mustard. Happy days. I'd have to wade in if I am in the area.

ashIsOuBlOPOXBog3YE_AA.text: I was really excited to see Big Apple Hot Dogs at the Street Feast. Somehow even though this cart is around the corner from my flat I just never have gotten around to trying it. We went all out and got the huge pole, 8 inches of the magnificent pork & beef blend seasoned with sage, mace and cayenne pepper and sitting on top of a nice toasty bun with caramelized onions.The dog was big and juicy. It did not fit in the bun and spilled out on each end. Not a traditional NYC hot dog but still mighty tasty!

qBDByaTOOduMCF1WBaEXOg.text: It's like this: The Man has a cart and sells hot dogs/sausages. This in itself shows that The Man understands. Hotdogs are street food and should be eaten on the street after having drunk more than you should have been allowed. Sauces and condiments should be added and spilled liberally on expensive trainers. It's the law. AND the hotdogs are very very good. If you're looking for the traditional hotdog- the Big Frank is the epitome. It's exactly what you want. If not, go for the the Big Dog. It's a polish sausage of impressive stature. Not down with pig? Get the 100% beef dogs. You know you want to. I have to stop here because I feel slightly uncomfortable. I keep wanting to describe things, but all I keep coming up with words like Huge and Succulent and in conjunction with various terms for sausage, it's a bit... um.. suggestive. So, in conclusion -Go find Big Apple Hot Dogs and feast on the hottest, juiciest, most meaty pork swords/tube steaks London has to offer.

photos.caption: Photo of Big Apple Hot Dogs - London, United Kingdom. BIG FRANK is BIG

cvYAdzZxy2MN1gf1h5PxDA.text: There is a severe shortage of good hot dog vendors in this town, and luckily Big Apple Hot Dogs has stepped up to fill this niche. Now when I think of hot dogs, I don't imagine those hyper-processed spam-like frankfurters that you get at the supermarket in packs of 12, I mean a hearty full-bodied curvy spiced bit of meat bursting at the seams of its casing. Tuck it in a bun a few sizes too small and cover it in ketchup, mustard, caramelised onions and then you have a 'dog worthy of the name. Big Apple can provide just that.One of the Eat St vendors, the Big Apple stall can be found most Fridays at the London Street Feast and periodically through the week at Kings Cross. Quick tip...if you check in via the Yelp app you can get yourself a free drink!They have a selection of 'dogs but I went for the full beef traditional 'dog. Overall, I'd say it was pretty good. Maybe not up there with some of the offerings I've had in NYC and Chicago, but better than anything you can get here. After building it to spec (as described above) with the addition of some of The Rib Man's hot pepper bbq sauce, I proceeded to demolish it in just over a minute. The meat was juicy and full of flavour, the onions sweet and added a bit of crunch, and the sauces some acidity and spice. Yep, it was good. Be warned, if you add sauces it's going to get messy. Grab plenty of paper towel and be careful of your clothes as mustard stains don't suit anybody's look. One area of improvement - the bun. The first time my bun was decidedly average and I was left wondering if they decided to save some time and dough and just get generic hot dog buns. The second time the bun tasted a bit stale so I'm pretty sure the focus is on the sausage not the bread. Not a dealbreaker, but given the evident love and care that goes into everything else, it's a bit of a letdown when something as simple as bread isn't up to scratch.

sQoacWJw6FUrmnN03mtWHw.text: Wow, these were the best hot dogs I can  remember eating!  They're right when they say 'the best tasting this side of the pond', and they would have a seriously great run on the other side of the Atlantic.  I'm from Canada, my wife from the USA (including a stint in NYC)... now that they have set up another shop in Chapel Market, a Sunday hot dog will be our new Sunday ritual.  I like the more minimal toppings, that way you don;t drown out the taste of the dog, and the soft moist buns tasted great as well.Mouth is watering just writing this....

WeC9SD2p4kRHyi4K9MKh0Q.text: I was stoked when I found Big Apple Hot Dogs last spring (they have a kick ass website). I've been to their Old street spot, as well as when they set up on Kings Boulevard (now called Kerb, formerly Eat St). Being from NY I can back these guys up. They made delicious hot dogs, and provide all the necessary toppings. Yum.Oh yeah and the owner is a real boss.

Kyplfo0u8ho-pHTPTWb8lQ.text: Big Apple Hot Dogs is only open 12-6pm Tuesday to Friday, so I decided to work from home today specifically so I could pop down at lunchtime to try one of their famous dogs (it's also 20 degrees for the first time this year and I wanted to wear shorts...).Given the name, I was expecting something along the lines of a NYC Hot Dog - a guilty pleasure of mine every time I visit the Big Apple. I was surprised and at first a little disappointed that they're really not that similar at all - apart from perhaps the bun. But as soon as I took the first bite I realised that this was no bad thing! The sausages are big, juicy and very tasty. I had a the half beef, half pork, which was delish. It reminded me more of (excellent) sausages I've had in German markets rather than on the streets on Manhattan. It's a little more expensive than a New York dog, but given how big it is, at £4 I think it's a steal!I see a few more working from home days coming up over Summer...
